name: The Longest Five Minutes
summary: Our hero faces the origin of all evil, the Overlord himself, but suddenly loses all memories of his adventure.
storyline:
"Our hero faces the origin of all evil, the Demon King himself, but suddenly loses all memories of his adventure. 
 
His finishing moves, the name of his hometown, and even the reason he's trying to defeat the Demon King in the first place, all gone. Our hero feels as though he's letting his allies down... 
 
In the midst of battle, his ally's words and the Demon King's taunting triggers flashbacks, bringing his memories back piece by piece. 
 
Our hero tries to regain his priceless memories before it's too late, but the Demon King stands before him, his power unyielding! 
 
What can happen in The Longest Five Minutes!?"

esrb.synopsis: This is a role-playing game in which players help a warrior regain his memories in order to defeat a demon king. Players relive lost memories by controlling the warrior's party around a world map and battling fantastical creatures (e.g., demons, sludge men, man-eating train) corrupted by evil. Players can use weapon attacks and magic spells to defeat enemies in turn-based combat. Damage is indicated by slashing effects, impact sounds, and colorful light flashes. The game contains some suggestive material: dialogue that states, “Thank the Goddess for big boobs,” “There's a rumor going around that the spring will clear up your skin and fill out your chest,” and “Let's go peep on the girls!!!”; one sequence depicts male characters spying on bathing female characters. During the course of the game, a character discusses and consumes alcohol (e.g., “Gulp. . .Gulp. . .Gulp. . . Full-bodied! Fragrant! All of it, first-class! . . . You must continue making this exquisite wine”). In one of the cities, there is a casino in which players can play a slot-machine mini-game; players can bet their in-game money, spin the five slots, and either lose or win. The words “a*s” and “bastard” appear within the text of the game.
